DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective propose research determine efficacy Digital Cognitive Behavior Therapy ( dCBTI ) prevent incidence depression among insomniacs . In addition , identify salient sociological/environmental variable , socioeconomic status ( SES ) , racial/ethnic minority-status , work schedule , child-care responsibility ( i.e. , child age 3 ) , stigma , moderate effect intervention .
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine effectiveness Digital Cognitive Behavior Therapy Insomnia ( dCBTI ) prevent incidence depression among insomniacs . dCBTI online form Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) use people experience trouble sleep night ( insomniac ) . This study allow u determine whether form digital therapy helpful preventing development depression people suffer insomnia . Participants recruit several well developed source , include HFHS Sleep Center Clinical database . Once participant meet inclusion criterion provide consent , link internet portal provide complete remain survey question . After completion assessment , participant automatically randomize one 2 active online insomnia treatment condition . Each treatment involve 6 weekly `` session '' take 20 minute complete . A post-treatment questionnaire immediately follow 6-week treatment phase complete . In addition , follow questionnaire assessment complete approximately 1 year treatment . Each 3 separate questionnaire take 20-30 minute complete . Participants compensate .
DOC.criteria: Meets Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders Fifth Edition ( DSMV ) criteria insomnia Untreated sleep disorder ( e.g. , obstructive sleep apnea , restless leg syndrome ) , unstable severe depression , bipolar disorder , history seizure disorder
